comments.author: DevilSlayer
comments.body: The main charting platform that I used is the tradingview not paid and I only use the free version like you, I don't need to pay because I only use 3 indicators which is the Simple moving average, volume and RSI. There are a lot of pop up ads but for me it is okay as long as I can easily read and understand the chart. When it comes to screener, I use investagrams because they have good screeners than in trading view. There are certain parameters like in moving average that trading view doesn't have so I use investagrams for screeners for me to successful watchlisting all of the good cryptocurrencies. I also want to add the cryptobubbles, one of the great platforms that we can use for us to find good and momentum cryptocurrencies.1. Investagrams.com2. cryptobubbles.net

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on March 17, 2023, 10:21:35 AMI mostly work on trading view but TV(tradingview) is not free and there are lot of ads poping up all the time, also, TV have many different type of indicators free and paid, If you use a free version of Trading View, you must accept such annoying advertisement banner and limited indicators to use as well as it does not allow you to use many indicators at the same time.I believe if you are a trader, trade regularly enough, you will have to buy a Trading View Premium. It is worthy to pay for that version as you can use some more advanced indicators. It will allow more indicators at the same time on one chart but it is not what I like. Because when you trade long time enough, you will know that you don't need to use many indicators on a same chart.You can wait for annual Black Friday event from Trading View to buy with very good discount price and +1 month to use.

comments.body: 1️⃣TradingView:Pro: Wide range of technical analysis tools, extensive library of indicators, and a large user community for sharing ideas.Con: Some advanced features are available only with a paid subscription.2️⃣MetaTrader 4 (MT4):Pro: Robust charting capabilities, support for algorithmic trading, and a large selection of custom indicators and expert advisors.Con: Limited flexibility in terms of customization and modern design compared to newer charting platforms.3️⃣ThinkorSwim (by TD Ameritrade):Pro: Powerful charting tools, advanced studies, and a user-friendly interface.Con: Availability limited to TD Ameritrade clients, making it less accessible for traders on other brokerage platforms.4️⃣ProRealTime:Pro: Comprehensive charting package with advanced technical analysis tools, market scanning capabilities, and a user-friendly interface.Con: Pricing can be relatively expensive for some traders, especially those with limited budgets.5️⃣NinjaTrader:Pro: Feature-rich charting platform, extensive customization options, and compatibility with multiple data feeds and brokerages.Con: The learning curve can be steep for beginners, and some advanced features are available only with a paid license.Source: https://1vane.com/top-10-best-crypto-brokers

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: I tried many of the other platforms but I still prefer tradingview. And yes its not cheap but what you can do is wait for the Black Friday sale and I think they offer a 60% discount if you pay yearly. Its obviously not free but its a fair price for what you are getting.They have reliable alerts and have platform that you can use both on mobile and on your computer. The other platforms are just not as user friendly but if you don't want to pay anything then you can always make it work.The ads are not that bad with the mobile app, I dont think ive ever encountered an ad there. Only with the desktop version. The only issue is that you are limited in the amount of features.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Do you really need anything more than TradingView? Imo looking for a TradingView alternative is like looking for a Google or ChatGPT alternative — you're simply using the best already.And if you need the extra features and you're actually profitable with your trading, then why not just pay for Pro?
